author: Michael Sohn
title: Trump has 'a number of people' to succeed Cohn: White House
text:
President Donald Trump can choose from a pool of people to succeed the White House's top economic adviser Gary Cohn , who is expected to leave soon, Press Secretary Sarah Sanders told Fox News Channel on Wednesday.
"He's got a number of people that he can choose from. But in the meantime, Gary will still be here as a voice for the next several weeks and we've got some great people from the economic community that help guide on this," she said in an interview in front of the White House.
Sanders also said that Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross "help lead the president" on making decisions about the economy.
